I meant I didn't know if this particular one had changed. I was laughing at=
 what it said :)

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Sumption 
 =
 To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 2:44 PM
  Subjec=
t: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.






  I know they can change, I'v=
e had them answer live off a pre-recorded tape.

   F-S


  On Fri, May 29,=
 2009 at 2:32 PM, April Abercrombie <april@...> wr=
ote:





    LOL!! I don't know.

      ----- Original Message ----- 
    =
  From: Frank Sumption 
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
      Sent: Frid=
ay, May 29, 2009 2:12 PM
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config=
. [1 Attachment]



       At about 10 seconds "chris makes riches off this=
"? So was that there at the time of recording or does it get changed?

    =
   F-S


      On Fri, May 29, 2009 at 8:01 AM, April Abercrombie <april@ab=
ercrombieghostresearch.com> wrote:





        If you let him that is.

  =
        ----- Original Message ----- 
          From: April Abercrombie 
  =
        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
          Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 8=
:00 AM
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.



         =
 I think the bottom line is we all know that Chris Moon is probably just tr=
ying to use you. He'll suck you dry and toss you aside when he gets his fil=
l.

            ----- Original Message ----- 
            From: Fransen, De=
bbie 
            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
            Sent: Friday, Ma=
y 29, 2009 7:45 AM
            Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config=
.



            Exactly my point... You don't charge anything for the boxe=
s
            and Chris Moon charges people for using it....
            If=
 it's not perfected then Chris shouldn't charge either......
            If=
 he wasn't so public with it, then people like me wouldn't dislike him so m=
uch.

            The only people that have your boxes (that the public hea=
r about)
            are the well known paranormal groups and famous people=
.
            I am sure that you have given boxes to researchers who are no=
t in the popular
            paranormal community ,and don't want to be. Th=
ose are the ones that should
            get respect.  And of course YOU ar=
e well respected by us lowly researchers. ( Kissin up , so you won't get ma=
d)

            And I am sure that you are sick of hearing about Chris Moon=
 and how
            alot of people thinks he sucks. And everyone wants a b=
ox......
            But you have to expect that. You are the only one out =
there that is honest and
            doesn't want to be famous.
           =
 I know this is like beating a dead horse, so I will shut up now.... :)



=


--------------------------------------------------------------------
    =
        From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On B=
ehalf Of Frank Sumption
            Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 9:22 AM
    =
        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
            Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Diff=
erent chip config.



             Keep in mind the money thing works two w=
ays, I also don't sell/charge for the boxes. Someday I will--when it's perf=
ected!

             Frank-S


            On Fri, May 29, 2009 at 6:16 AM,=
 Fransen, Debbie <debbie.fransen@...> wrote:





              Of co=
urse Chris Moon speaks highly of him.
              Frank has made him lots=
 of money.



-------------------------------------------------------------=
-----
              From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps.com] On Behalf Of Elaine Coates
              Sent: Thursday, May 28, 20=
09 3:49 PM 

              To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com

              Subje=
ct: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.




              Okay, then could=
 I have a copy of the new schematic when you get it drawn?  That would be e=
ven better.  Where are you from?  Chris Moon speaks highly of you.




----=
--------------------------------------------------------------
            =
  From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
              To: EVP-IT=
C@yahoogroups.com
              Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 2:29:09 PM
   =
           Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.


              Be=
sides--I didn't like that radio design, it's too complex, and the documenta=
tion is screwy. I did a simpler radio last night that should be better, sim=
pler, cheaper, and clearer sound. 



              On Thu, May 28, 2009 at=
 5:41 AM, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@ yahoo.com> wrote:





              =
  The jpg for this schematic is kind of blurry in places.  Is there any way=
 a more clear copy could be send to me? I would be forever grateful.  Thank=
s Frank - Elaine




------------------------------------------------------=
----------
                From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com=
>

                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                Sent: Thurs=
day, May 28, 2009 12:55:00 AM
                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Differ=
ent chip config.



                http://purplealieng irl.tripod. com/ 

=
                 However, it's constantly changing. The radio I made tonigh=
t is very simple, and can significantly simplify construction. I used to ma=
ke the sweep and amplifier circuits, then use a commercial radio, like the =
12-469, as a tuner. 

                 The MK484 is follwed by a couple hig=
h impedence op amp stages to bring the audio up to line levels. I haven't h=
ad time to do schematic yet. I draw the schematics with MS paint, and they =
are stored as jpeg images, which isn't the best, but it makes them e-mailab=
le. 

                 Frank-S


                On Wed, May 27, 2009 at 8:=
54 PM, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@ yahoo.com> wrote:





                 =
 Hi folks, I just joined this group.  I was recently at the Lizzy Borden ho=
use in Massachusetts with Chris Moon and had a session with Frank's Box.  T=
he results were astounding.  Is this the newest schematic for Frank's box? =
 If so, is there a way to get a clearer copy of it?  My son said he would b=
uild one for me and I have been searching for the schematic.  Can anyone he=
lp? - Elaine




----------------------------------------------------------=
----
                  From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com>

 =
                 To: evp-itc@yahoogroups .com; grassharp@yahoogrou ps.com 
=

                  Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 5:45:16 PM
               =
   Subject: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config. [1 Attachment]




           =
        I think I followed an erroneous LM3820 layout, so I'm going to brea=
dboard this layout. Note the antenna input is now on pin 12-11, this is the=
 RF amp input, and pin 13 is the RF amp output, which feeds pin 1.

       =
            'case anyone cares. 

                   F-S


















=
